utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey, oh, we ran into your mom at Benihana last night.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, she loves that place. Every time they flip a shrimp in the air, she practically leaps out of her seat to catch it. That’s why I don’t take her to SeaWorld.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know you-you don’t want to hear it, but she was there with Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s fine. I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: Rajj
utterance.content: It doesn’t bug you when they go out on dates?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They’re not dating. They’re just two friends who went out to dinner.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And then went back to the home they share where they probably fell asleep in the matching pajamas she got them because they both just love penguins.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, lots of people wear matching pajamas who aren’t dating.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like who?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Like you and your dog.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t rule out the dating.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine, it bothers me. You happy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You think you’ve got problems. The gibbon is the only member of the ape family not classified as a great ape.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How is this helpful?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All the non-human apes are classified as great apes except one. That means taxonomists created the entire category of lesser ape just to single out the poor gibbon as the weird kid on the playground. Now there’s a hairy little fellow with a genuine beef.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But the gibbon doesn’t know what it’s categorized as. It doesn’t even know it’s called a gibbon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: True. Sorry, kid, you’ve got it worse than a gibbon.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We brought snacks for movie night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, great. I don’t suppose you also brought napkins, clean bowls, utensils and a roll of toilet paper.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Right here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ah, You guys are the best.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s with the clothes?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, with all the new stuff I bought for work, I needed to make room in my closet.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I meant why are they folded? But whatever. Ooh, what’s this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That, believe it or not, is my prom dress.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wow, you still have it? I just assumed it was balled up in the corner of a barn somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What kind of teenager did you think I was?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Slutty.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Easy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The word is popular.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How was your prom? Did you go?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, but I was on clean-up crew.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw, that’s sad.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, it was okay. The DJ let me dance one slow song with my mop before he shut down. Whenever I see a bucket of dirty water, I still hear Lady in Red.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: My prom was pretty terrible, too. I was so excited about my date, but it turned out he only asked me ’cause he liked my friend. He spent the whole night talking about her.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, we get it, you had a friend and a date. Stop bragging.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter. Prom is silly anyways.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Easy for you to say; you probably went with the captain of the football team.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. I just made out with him a little while his date was puking.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: My date would’ve had to clean that up.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ooh, I have an idea. Maybe we can have, like, a prom do-over.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, that would be so much fun. We could decorate the roof and make the guys wear tuxedos.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ooh, and get our hair done, and slow-dance.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, guys, trust me, as someone who’s been to, like, seven proms, it is never as good as you want it to be.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You went to seven proms?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, let’s see. Uh, four Under the Seas, two Enchanted Evenings, and one Night to Remember that I cannot remember for the life of me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, where’s Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She and Amy are out dress shopping for their prom thing.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I got that Evite. Ever since I saw Pretty in Pink, I’ve wanted to go to an American prom. But then I saw Carrie, and I did not want to go to an American prom. But then I saw Never Been Kissed, and I’m back on the prom bandwagon. This prom thing’s been a real roller coaster.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernie’s really excited. I could tell because her voice got so high, the beagle next door started howling.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did you go to your prom?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. I had a date with a proper education. Instead of a tuxedo, I dressed myself in good habits. Instead of spiked punch, I enjoyed the intoxicating flavour of knowledge. Instead of dancing in a gym, I shook my bootyto the seductive rhythms…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: Shldon
utterance.content: …of AP Calculus.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How come you’re not shopping with Amy and Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let me guess, you think the whole idea is lame?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, who cares what I think? What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm, to be honest, it’s kind of a dream come true to go to even a fake prom with a woman as beautiful as you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh, thanks a lot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, now I can’t blow this thing off without being a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That sounds like a yes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ooh, every single person RSVP’d yes. This is so exciting. Isn’t this exciting?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Look, even Stuart’s bringing a date. I wonder who it is.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know exactly who it is. He’s gonna bring my mom. Why did you even invite him?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Because he’s our friend, and you two need to get along. And why can’t he take your mom? You took her to your prom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I didn’t take her, she was a chaperone.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I saw a picture of you two dancing together.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What was I gonna do? They were playing our song. I can’t take this anymore.

utterance.speaker: Stuart (on phone)
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stuart, we have to talk. This thing with you and my mom, I hate it. It’s making me crazy. You and I were friends for years, and now you’re bringing my mother to a party I’m going to? What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I’m not bringing your mother, I have a date.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, so now you’re cheating on my mother?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. What are you talking about? There’s nothing weird going on with me and your mother.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Stewie, your bath is getting cold!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I got to go, bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny? Penny? Penny? Penny? Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You knocked more than usual.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Next time I might be in a rush, it’s good to have a few in the bank.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’d like to discuss this party that Amy and Bernadette are throwing. Since you and I are both reluctant to go, I think I’ve come up with a perfect way for us to enjoy it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great, how?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We pretend we’re aliens. I’m not the best at reading facial cues, but I’m gonna say that you love it and want to hear more. Now, in the beloved novel Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, an alien named Ford Prefect pretended to be human in order to blend in so that he could write an entry about Earth for The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, which is a travel book within the actual book, which is also called The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, just one question. What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My point is, pretending to be an alien is a valuable coping mechanism I’ve used many times. I did it the first time I went to see you in a play. You had no idea Commander Umfrumf of Ceti Alpha Three was in the audience. Oh, don’t worry, he gave you seven thumbs up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Here’s a question, as an alien pretending to be human, are you planning to engage in any post-prom mating rituals with Amy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There are post-prom mating rituals?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not always. Unless your date drives a van with an air mattress, then always.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if it’s part of the prom experience, then I’m open to it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I may be an alien, but I have urges. If Amy wants to copulate by firing her eggs into space, well, then, I will happily catch them with the reproductive sac on my upper flermin. I’m not the best at reading facial cues, but I can see that you’re a little turned on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, if you’re not gonna learn how to do this, they make some pretty good clip-ons.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bruce Wayne doesn’t wear a clip-on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bruce Wayne doesn’t make his roommate tie it for him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: His name is Alfred, and, yes, he does.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There, perfect.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, are you sure? It’s my first prom, I want to do it correctly.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought you were gonna pretend to be an alien.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was, but Penny didn’t want to. You didn’t want to. Bernadette, Amy, Koothrappali and Wolowitz didn’t want to. And even I knew it was weird to hire somebody.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Was that a flask?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I’ve decided to embrace all of the traditions associated with prom, including spiking the punch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re gonna put alcohol in the punch?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, this is pomegranate juice. It’s all the fun of high school high jinks with the cell-protecting zip of antioxidants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you had ripped jeans and a leather jacket, you’d be like the toughest kid on the Disney Channel. So, anything else planned for tonight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, everything. Getting our picture taken, slow-dancing, being elected prom king. Pointing out that kings aren’t elected. It’s gonna be off the hook.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And while you’re at it, I know that at this age your hormones are raging, but just because all your friends are having sex doesn’t mean you have to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, ’cause, ’cause a lot of people lose their virginity on prom night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny implied the same thing. Is this true?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just relax, it’s a joke. You don’t have hormones.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow, you look amazing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you, so do you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, you look so handsome.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, doesn’t Amy look hot? That’s got to put some starch in the upper flermin.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, it’s a scaly genital organ that grows between his shoulder blades. Try not to touch it when you’re dancing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t do this. And for your information, Leonard, the upper flermin doesn’t grow between my shoulder blades, it grows out of the belly button on my neck.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s right, I was thinking of the lower flermin.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, I’ll, uh, text Stuart, let him know we’re close.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s a neat tattoo.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, thanks, it’s Sally from Nightmare before Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Aw, that movie’s so cute.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you like her because you both have red hair?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Uh, a little, but more that she’s covered in scars and can pull her own limbs off and sew them back on.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I like Cinderella.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Did you know, in the original book, the sisters cut off their toes with knives in order to fit in the glass slipper?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I like Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, here comes Stuart and his date.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, she’s cute.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s Jeanie.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s Jeanie?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Who’s Jeanie?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t say it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s Howard’s cousin that he had sex with.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She is my second cousin. We were 15, I just said, don’t say it.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: No, it’s okay. He told me that story a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was our first date, there was an awkward silence. What was I supposed to say?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, it’s beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, the girls really did a nice job.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw, I know I wasn’t into this before, but I’m so glad I get to take you to your first prom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What makes you think I didn’t go to my prom? I went.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, who’d you go with?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I took a little lady I like to call loneliness.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, it’s all right. We ended up having a threesome with her friend humiliation, so…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, if I would have been there and saw you alone, I would’ve asked you to dance.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, you wouldn’t have.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It was before my growth spurt.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What, that already happened?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Very funny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you wouldn’t have asked me either.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I would have asked you. In my head. On the way home. While I was having a good cry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, can I come in?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t think that’s a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: According to an online message board, I may be having a panic attack. SoccerMom09 had similar symptoms. But to be fair, the twins were a real handful that day.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re making me worry. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s going on is we’re about to go to a prom. And there’s a great deal of pressure on young couples like us to engage in what Mr. Bob Eubanks called making whoopee.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What pressure? All I said was you look handsome. Can you please open the door?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not just that. Leonard and Penny also made comments about it. And I’m not blind. Even I looked twice when I saw my posterior in these tuxedo pants.

utterance.speaker: Sceme
utterance.content: The limo.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So, I met Jeanie at your Aunt Gladys’. She passed me the Manischewitz, I took one look at this punim, and I almost plotzed on the kugel.

utterance.speaker: Rajj
utterance.content: Is this what I sound like when I talk about India?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, my mother’s okay with this?

utterance.speaker: Jeannie
utterance.content: Why would your mother have a problem with me and Stuart?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: ‘Cause they have a weird, inappropriate relationship.

utterance.speaker: Jeannie
utterance.content: Weirder than what you and I did in my dad’s Corolla?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This is so messed up.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I know, I’m having the best time.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why would you even come to this? Didn’t you know I’d be here?

utterance.speaker: Jeannie
utterance.content: It was a long time ago, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: And you’re only second cousins, who cares?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, you knew and you brought her anyway?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, so she’s good enough for Howard, but not for me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, go have weird relationships with your own mother and cousin. This is his turf.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I might not have asked you to dance then, but I will ask you now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s no music.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t care. We’ll make our own music.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My God, who’s the dork now? Thank you for wearing your flats.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you for wearing your heels.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look at me. Dancing with the prettiest girl at the prom.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Want to take a picture of us and send it to your old friends in the chess club?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I sent them a bikini shot of you years ago. This is nice. I kind of wish no one else was coming.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know, me, too. But it will be fun to have a prom without all the drama.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, get off of him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not until he stops humping his way up my family tree.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, this is silly. I’m not missing another prom. I’m going upstairs now. Good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I really did think you looked pretty.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You did?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. So much so that I started to panic.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, you can relax. Just because you think I look pretty doesn’t mean we have to spend the night together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Were you hoping we would because it’s prom?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m always hoping. But tonight I just wanted to have a nice time with you. And maybe dance with someone who has arms.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you for understanding.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course I understand. Sheldon, there’s something else I’ve been wanting to say, but before I do, I just, I want you to know that you don’t have to say it back. I know you’re not ready, and I don’t want you to say it just because social convention dictates…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You said it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s no denying I have feelings for you that can’t be explained in any other way. I briefly considered that I had a brain parasite. But that seems even more farfetched. The only conclusion was love. I know what’s happening. This is a panic attack. SoccerMom09 says to lie down with your feet elevated.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Just because I love you doesn’t mean girls are allowed in my room.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. Here we go, say cheese. Iskip) Say cheese. Iskip) Say cousin. Iskip) Say…

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, sorry. Hang on, sorry. Hey, Debbie. I, yeah, yeah, I’m here with Jeanie. Okay, but we’re just friends. It’s, yeah. I got to go.
